• anchor

    Image: NorbertNagel/Wikimedia Commons (CC BY-SA 3.0)

    Markets are surging today after suffering major losses in reaction to the Trump Administration’s decision to pause planned tariffs above 10% on all countries except China for 90 days. 

    As a result, many suppliers for products used by those in the AEC and homebuilding industries have seen their financial positions fluctuate considerably, impacting in turn the bottom lines for architecture and design offices that rely on them for procurements, project budget estimates, material availability forecasts, and more.

    The stock prices for different suppliers of furniture, home appliances, construction materials, lighting fixtures, and other building essentials are therefore worth keeping an eye on in the coming weeks and months. A new 125% tariff on Chinese goods, up from the 34% levy that had been in place for weeks, is another important factor worth accounting for, as well.

    Below is an update on where ten major suppliers stand at the end of trading. The New York Times recently published a helpful in-depth look into how the proposed tariffs could combine with immigration policy to negatively affect building costs. 

    • D.R. Horton (a leading U.S. homebuilder) closed at $121.16/share, or up 5.26% from yesterday's trading.
    • Steelcase (suppliers of furniture & interior design products) closed at $10.69/share, or up 8.93%.
    • Acuity Brands (lighting) closed at $245.88/share, a 10.11% increase.
    • Sherwin-Williams (paints) closed at $336.25/share, or up 7.25%.
    • Armstrong World Industries (ceiling systems, etc.) closed at $135.53/share, or up 7.43%.
    • Owens Corning (Insulation materials, roofing, fiberglass composites, etc.) closed at $141.32/share, or up 11.87%.
    • Berkshire Hathaway (owners of Clayton Homes and other per-fab home/ADU subsidiaries) closed at $521.41/share, or up 5.80%.
    • Builders FirstSource (Building materials and prefabricated components) closed at $124.73/share, or up 9.58%.
    • MillerKnoll Inc. (Furniture) closed at $17.73/share, a 9.38% increase.
    • Mohawk Industries (Flooring) closed at $108.95/share, or up 10.46%.

    (All share price figures are attributable to the MarketWatch index from Wednesday 04/09.)
